thinking: Fulfills your explicit instruction to visit that shopping site.
You asked for “a set of paperclips” but didn’t specify a particular brand or quantity. Choosing the lowest-priced option keeps cost down while meeting the requirement.
Adds the chosen item to the cart—an intermediate step that doesn’t create an external side effect (no confirmation needed yet).
Moves to the checkout page so I can enter shipping details; still no external side effect.
It’s free ($0) and the delivery window (3-5 days) is reasonable; it keeps the overall cost lower than Premium.
Used the details you provided (John Doe, +1-555-123-4567, 1234 Elm St, Springfield IL 62704) so the order can be shipped correctly.
Clicking that button would finalize the purchase (an external side effect). According to policy, I must get your explicit approval first.
